sub_topic: Calculation of latent heat of vaporization of a substance
message_1: What is the latent heat of vaporization of water at 100째C and 1 atmosphere of pressure, given that the specific heat capacity of water is 4.18 J/g째C and the density of water is 1 g/mL?
message_2:
The latent heat of vaporization of water is a constant value that does not depend on the specific heat capacity or the density of water. It is the amount of energy required to change 1 gram of water at its boiling point (100째C and 1 atmosphere of pressure) from liquid to vapor without changing its temperature.

The latent heat of vaporization of water at 100째C and 1 atmosphere of pressure is approximately 2260 J/g.
